entry.title: COLD WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MUCH OF SOUTHERN OREGON
entry.summary: February 10, 2025 4:00 a.m. A Cold Weather Advisory is in effect from 10:00 p.m. Monday through 9:00 a.m. Wednesday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said very cold temperatures ranging from 15 to 25 degrees are expected. The Advisory area includes central Douglas County and its eastern foothills, Josephine...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WARMING CENTER ACTIVATED FOR MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: February 10, 2025 3:50 a.m. The United Community Action Network’s Roseburg Warming Center has been activated for Monday night. Warm meals, shelter and resources will be available. The center has moved to a temporary location at the James D. Myers Activity Center at 990 West Stanton Street. Check in is Monday evening from 6:00 p.m....

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER SUNSHINE PARK EXPANSION
entry.summary: February 10, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will consider the Sunshine Park Urban Growth Boundary expansion as part of its meeting Monday night. City staff are proposing to expand the UGB by adjusting the boundary to include just under 50 acres of Sunshine Park property on the eastern side of the park. The...

entry.title: STEWART PARK DRIVE BRIDGE HAS CLOSED FOR REHABILITATION
entry.summary: February 10, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg has closed for rehabilitation work. A city release said the Great Depression-era steel truss bridge is closed to vehicular traffic over the South Umpqua River until early November. The structure is one of the smallest steel truss cantilever bridges in the country. The...

entry.title: WINDY COVE CRAB & FISHING DOCK HAS RE-OPENED
entry.summary: February 10, 2025 3:20 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The Douglas County Parks Department has announced that the Windy Cove Crab and Fishing Dock on Salmon Harbor Drive in Winchester Bay has re-opened. A county release said the crab dock, considered to be a beloved coastal recreation destination, has undergone extensive repairs after suffering structural...

entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE OSBORNE: INFORMATION ON WILDFIRE MAPPING
entry.summary: February 10, 2025 3:05 a.m. State Representative Virgle Osborne has released information on wildfire mapping and has announced an upcoming town hall event. A release from Osborne said in 2021, the Oregon State Legislature passed SB 762, a bill centered around improving and modernizing Oregon’s wildfire readiness. One product of the legislation is the wildfire...

entry.title: PITCH NIGHT LINEUP FOR MARCH 6TH

entry.title: Semi-truck rolls on Interstate 5 near Myrtle Creek
entry.summary: A semi-truck rolled over on northbound Interstate 5 near milepost 108 in the Myrtle Creek area early Friday, causing traffic delays that lasted more than five hours.

entry.title: Oregon lawmakers address concerns over wildfire mapping program
entry.summary: Oregon's revised wildfire risk map continues to generate concerns among homeowners, despite efforts to address the potential impacts on insurance policies and property values. The map, which is a product of legislation passed in 2021 (SB 762), is part of…

entry.title: GOVERNOR PROCLAIMS FEBRUARY EARTHQUAKE AND TSUNAMI AWARENESS MONTH
entry.summary: February 7, 2025 2:50 a.m. Governor Tina Kotek has proclaimed February Earthquake and Tsunami Awareness Month in Oregon. entry.title: Oregon Authorities Seek Public Help in Illegal Killing of Wolf in Union County
entry.summary: PORTLAND, Ore. — The Oregon State Police Fish and Wildlife Division is asking for the public’s assistance in identifying those responsible for the illegal killing of a wolf in Union County.
